alert.note: Alert for Inland Cameron; Southern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 21 at 1:41AM CST until January 21 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Some icing expected. Very cold wind chills expected. The ice will result in very slippery conditions on sidewalks, roads and bridges, including during the morning commute. Total ice accumulations of a light glaze are expected. Expect wind chills to range from 20 to 30 degrees. * WHERE...Southern Hidalgo and Inland Cameron County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, 3 AM to 12 PM today. For the Wind Chill Advisory, Until to 12 PM this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 30 minutes to exposed skin.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of ice are expected This will make travel very hazardous or impossible. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and the wind will combine to create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken. Make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
